problem: When Trilisa takes pictures, they turn out with probability $\frac{1}{5}$. She wants to take enough pictures so that the probability of at least one turning out is at least $\frac{3}{4}$. How few pictures can she take to accomplish this?
solution:
The probability that at least one picture turns out is $1$ minus the probability that all the pictures do not turn out.  Since the probability that one picture will not turn out is $\frac{4}{5}$, the probability that $n$ pictures all do not turn out is $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^n$.  So we want

$$\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^n<\frac{1}{4}\Rightarrow 4^{n+1}<5^n$$

We see that $4^7>5^6$, but $4^8<5^7$.  Thus the smallest allowable value of $n$ is $\boxed{7}$.
model_solution:
Let $x$ be the number of pictures Trilisa takes.
The probability that none of the pictures turn out is $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}$, so the probability that at least one of the pictures turns out is $1-\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}$. This is at least $1/4$ when $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq 3/4$.
$\frac{4}{5}\leq \frac{3}{4}$ is not true, so we solve $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq \frac{3}{4}$.
Step 2: $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq \frac{3}{4}\Rightarrow \frac{4^{x}}{5^{x}}\leq \frac{3}{4}$
$\frac{4^{x}}{5^{x}}\leq \frac{3}{4}\Rightarrow \frac{4^{x}}{3}\leq \frac{5^{x}}{4}$
$\frac{4^{x}}{3}\leq \frac{5^{x}}{4}\Rightarrow \frac{4^{x}}{3}-\frac{5^{x}}{4}\leq 0\Rightarrow 16\cdot\frac{4^{x-1}}{3}-\frac{5^{x}}{4}\leq 0$
$16\cdot\frac{4^{x-1}}{3}-\frac{5^{x}}{4}\leq 0\Rightarrow 16\cdot\frac{4^{x-1}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}\Rightarrow 64\cdot\frac{4^{x-2}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}$
$64\cdot\frac{4^{x-2}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}\Rightarrow 64\cdot\frac{4^{x-2}}{3}-\frac{5^{x}}{4}\geq 0\Rightarrow 256\cdot\frac{4^{x-3}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}$
$256\cdot\frac{4^{x-3}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}\Rightarrow 1024\cdot\frac{4^{x-4}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}$
$1024\cdot\frac{4^{x-4}}{3}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}\Rightarrow 3\cdot1024\cdot\frac{4^{x-4}}{4}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}\Rightarrow 768\cdot\frac{4^{x-4}}{1}\geq\frac{5^{x}}{4}$
steps: Let $x$ be the number of pictures Trilisa takes.

The probability that none of the pictures turn out is $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}$, so the probability that at least one of the pictures turns out is $1-\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}$. This is at least $1/4$ when $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq 3/4$.
$\frac{4}{5}\leq \frac{3}{4}$ is not true, so we solve $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq \frac{3}{4}$.

The probability that none of the pictures turn out is $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}$, so the probability that at least one of the pictures turns out is $1-\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}$. This is at least $1/4$ when $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq 3/4$.
$\frac{4}{5}\leq \frac{3}{4}$ is not true, so we solve $\left(\frac{4}{5}\right)^{x}\leq \frac{3}{4}$.
